library.description:
Modular and light-weight selection library.

Compatible with React and jQuery. Can also be used stand-alone.
library.name: Selectivity

library.description: SelectBoxIt allows you to replace ugly and hard to use HTML select boxes with gorgeous and feature rich drop downs. Twitter Bootstrap, jQueryUI, and jQuery Mobile themes are supported right out of the box. To use SelectBoxIt, you do not have to rewrite any of your existing form validation logic or event handling. SelectBoxIt just works.
library.name: SelectBoxIt

library.description: Select2 is a jQuery based replacement for select boxes. It supports searching, remote data sets, and infinite scrolling of results. Look and feel of Select2 is based on the excellent Chosen library.
library.name: Select2

library.description: Uniform masks your standard form controls with custom themed controls. It works in sync with your real form elements to ensure accessibility and compatibility.
library.name: Uniform

library.description: A JQuery Plugin for super-flexible Dropdowns based on dot.js Templates.
library.name: dropdown.dot.js

library.description: Chosen is a JavaScript plugin that makes long, unwieldy select boxes much more user-friendly. It is currently available in both jQuery and Prototype flavors.
library.name: Chosen

library.description: Provides the ability to add file manager (Finder) type highlighting to all elements based on the standard single click, command+click/ctrl+click, command+drag/ctrl+drag, command+A/ctrl+A and shift+click methods. This plugin will by default add a selected class to all clicked elements.
library.name: finderSelect
